primary.request: Check status of automatic maintenance fee withdrawal
primary.context: Customer expected an automatic payment to be processed but it has not occurred yet.
primary.detail: The agent entered a confirmation loop, repeating the customer's details back to them without providing an answer or a link, leading to customer confusion and hang-up.

steps: Agent identified caller via phone number and verified name and state.
Customer explained that an expected autopay withdrawal had not occurred.
Agent requested account number and property name for confirmation.
Agent repeated all collected information back to the customer as a question.
Customer became confused by the repetition and disconnected.

failure.detail: Agent engaged in excessive confirmation and repetition of data instead of providing the status or sending a portal link.

loops.subject: confirming request details
loops.note: Agent repeated same summary twice without acting.

insights.summary: The customer called to check why an automatic maintenance fee payment hadn't been withdrawn. The agent successfully verified the account but then entered a repetitive loop, summarizing the request back to the customer until they hung up in confusion.
insights.verbatim: Supposed to be an automatic withdrawal, but it has not come out yet. Is it going to come out?
insights.coaching: Once the account and property were confirmed, the agent should have provided the balance status or sent a portal link for the customer to check their autopay settings rather than just repeating the request.
